articles.author: Daniel Leberfeld
articles.title: 49ers Choose Mullens Over Kaepernick and Get Great Results
articles.description: When the San Francisco 49ers lost starting quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo to a season-ending injury in September, there were calls for them to sign Colin Kaepernick.
articles.content: When his backup, C.J. Beathard got hurt in October, you heard more calls for them to sign Kaepernick. But 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan took a pass each time, and based on what happened in their win over the Oakland Raiders Thursday night, it looks like a pragmat… [+2751 chars]

articles.title: Former CIA Director John Brennan Endorses Beto O’Rourke in Texas
articles.description: Former CIA director John Brennan endorsed prospective Texas senator Beto O'Rourke via Twitter on Friday morning.
articles.content: “As a former resident of Texas and a proud UT-Austin alumnus,” John Brennan said, “I believe Beto ORourke is the type of individual Texans need in the U.S. Senate to represent their best interests. He has the integrity, intellect, and character that is in sho… [+1855 chars]

articles.author: Michelle Moons
articles.title: Mike Braun Credits Donald Trump for Senate Challenge to Donnelly
articles.description: Republican Mike Braun stood beside President Donald Trump at Friday’s Indiana rally as he credited Trump’s 2016 run and victory for Braun’s decision to run for U.S. Senate.
articles.content: Never in my life did I think that I would be on the stage with the President of the United States, the VP, and Bobby Knight, Braun said in awe as he stood on a stage surrounded by 8,500 cheering people packing out the rally stadium. How could it get any bette… [+1079 chars]

articles.title: Majority U.S. Women: Democrats Used Kavanaugh Sexual Assault Accusations for Political Gain
articles.description: The majority of American women say Senate Democrats used sexual assault accusations against U.S. Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh for political gain, a new poll reveals.

articles.author: Joel B. Pollak, Joel B. Pollak
articles.title: Brett Kavanaugh Rape Accuser Admits She Made Up Her Story
articles.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee has referred a Kentucky woman to the Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) after she admitted making up an accusation that Justice Brett Kavanaugh had raped her.
articles.content: According to the referral, the woman, Judy Munro-Leighton, contacted the Senate Judiciary Committee regarding a letter presented by Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) from “Jane Doe” of Oceanside, California, who claimed that Kavanaugh had raped her “several times.” A… [+2401 chars]

articles.title: At Least Four Wounded After Man Opens Fire in Hot Yoga Class
articles.description: At least four people were wounded Friday night after an unidentified man opened fire in a hot yoga class in Tallahassee, Florida.
articles.content: The Tallahassee Democrat reports that a man entered the yoga studio, shot and wounded four people, then shot and killed himself. The yoga class is held over a bar, and bar customers reported that the wounded individuals came downstairs to seek help. Bar patro… [+1127 chars]

articles.author: Chriss W. Street
articles.title: Irvine Proclaims Solidarity Against Intolerance After Synagogue Vandalized
articles.description: Although there are still no suspects in the early Wednesday morning defacing of a synagogue with antisemitic graffiti, the City of Irvine proclaimed solidarity against intolerance.
articles.content: The City of Irvines website proudly proclaims the honor of being Americas Safest City for 13 th Year. But that did not stop a vandal from spray-painting antisemitic slurs on the exterior walls of Beth Jacob Synagogue at 3900 Michelson Drive at 1:18 AM on Hall… [+1991 chars]

articles.author: Kyle Morris
articles.title: POLL: Rick Scott Leads Bill Nelson by Five Points in Contentious Florida U.S. Senate Race
articles.description: A new poll of 696 active Florida voters shows Republican Rick Scott leading Democrat Bill Nelson by five-points in Florida's United States Senate race.
articles.content: According to the Vox Populi poll, 48 percent of those surveyed said they will vote for Scott, while 43 percent said they intend to vote for Nelson. Nine percent remain undecided in the poll. When factoring in undecided votes, Scott and Nelson are tied at 50 p… [+988 chars]

articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.title: Winning: Land O’ Lakes Offers Health Plans Nearly 50% Cheaper than Obamacare
articles.description: Land O’ Lakes announced on Thursday that they created America's first Association Health Plan (AHP), which offers plans nearly 50 percent less expensive than Obamacare, thanks to President Donald Trump’s executive actions on health care.
